msDesc.head: Theological and philosophical texts by William of Auvergne, Simon de Cassia, Konrad von Dryburg, and Heinrich von Langenstein. Germany, 15th century, first half

msItem.author: William of Auvergne
msItem.title: Tractatus novus de penitentia
msItem.incipit: Secunda tabula post naufragium qua post reparacionem et liberacionem rursum mersi eripimur
msItem.explicit: cum unigenito tuo deo et domino nostro Ihesu Christo et spiritu sancto paraclito dono sanctissimo tuo est omnis honor et gloria in secula seculorum Amen
msItem.note: Chapters 1–18 as far as fol. 15r, col. a, line 14 from the bottom pr. in Guilielmi Alverni episcopi Parisiensis … opera omnia … (1674), i, pp. 570–92, with the longer version of chapter 18 as pr. in ibid., ii, pt 2 (a Supplement, with separate pagination), pp. 229–31. The present MS. therefore seems to be a sort of hybrid between the MSS. as originally known to the editor, and a MS. of all 26 chapters (with chapters 18–26 as pr. in the Supplement).
msItem.bibl: Bloomfield, Virtues & Vices, no. 5371, citing the present MS.

P. Glorieux, ‘Le Tractatus novus de Poenitentia de Guillaume d’Auvergne’, Miscellanea moralia in honorem eximii domini Arthur Jansen, Universitatis Catholicae in oppido Lovaniensi professoris [Louvain, 1948/9], pp. 551–65.
Included among 17 MSS. listed by J. R. Ottman, ‘List of manuscripts and editions’, Autour de Guillaume d’Auvergne (+1249), ed. by F. Morenzoni and J.-Y. Tilliette (Turnhout, 2005), pp. 375–99 at 385.

msItem.author: William of Auvergne
msItem.title: De collacione beneficiorum
msItem.rubric: Liber de collacione beneficiorum Wilhelmi Parisiensis
msItem.incipit: Umbram vehemoth sicud scriptum est in xl Job. umbre protegant umbram scilicet opacam
msItem.explicit: Et si qua sunt circa hec maiora maioribus relinquentes. Et sic est finis sit laus et gloria trinis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Wilelmi Parisiensis de collacione et pluralitate beneficiorum
msItem.bibl: Among 37 MSS. listed by Ottman, op. cit., at p. 380.

msItem.author: William of Auvergne
msItem.title: De universo
msItem.incipit: Postquam auxilio dei eousque dedixi tractatum de parte nobiliori universi
msItem.explicit: auctori bonorum omnium deo attribuas cum actionibus gratiarum et sic est finis deo gratias.
msItem.note: One rubric is in German: ‘von den holden’ (fol. 59r)
msItem.bibl: Among 44 MSS. listed by Ottman, op. cit., at p. 387.
Glorieux, Faculté des arts, no. 148w, citing the present MS.
msItem.textLang: Latin (a few words in Middle Low German)

msItem.note: Capitula list for the preceding text
msItem.incipit: Capitula de demonibus. Primum de dispositionibus adventiciis
msItem.explicit: Utrum demones habeant propria nomina et sic est finis
msItem.note: Not included in the pr. ed. or other MSS., presumably because the contents are already summarised in the preface (pr. ed. p. 1015; this MS. fol. 25r).

msItem.author: William of Auvergne
msItem.title: De trinitate, notionibus, et praedicamentis in divinis
msItem.incipit: Oportet te prenosse in isto sacro et divinali magisterio
msItem.explicit: et hec est intencio unius et multi ubique
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit primus tractatus divinalis magistri Wilhelmi seu Gwilhelmi Parisiensis scilicet de sanctissima trinitate nocionibus et predicamentis in divinis
msItem.bibl: Pr. 1674, ii, pp. 1–64; ed. B. Switalski, De Trinitate, Pontifical Institute of Mediaeval Studies Studies and Texts, 34 (Toronto, 1976); trans. by R. J. Teske and F. C. Wade, The Trinity, or the First Principle (De trinitate, seu de primo principio) (Milwaukee, 1989).
Among 9 MSS. listed by Ottman, op. cit., at p. 386.

msItem.author: Simon de Cassia
msItem.title: De gestis domini salvatoris
msItem.incipit: Itaque ista erit aptissima regula ad propositum principale puta ad demonstrandum quod hii inquirentes utilitatem plebis
msItem.explicit: qui dat vitam mundo per Ihesum Christum dominum nostrum Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt determinaciones doctorum de crebra communione

msItem.author: Konrad von Dryburg
msItem.title: Determinatio de celebratione missae
msItem.rubric: Incipit determinacio .C. presbiter de celebratione missarum
msItem.incipit: Deus in adiutorium meum intende Scribitur in Ps lxix Reverendi patres domini et magistri cum non virtute sua fragilitas humana
msItem.explicit: ad aliquas horas peculiares vel vigilias mortuorum obligatur
msItem.finalRubric: Sic est finis C. presbiter de celebratione missarum summatim repetiti solempniter per Conradum ordinarum doctorem Erfordensis. Amen

msItem.author: Henricus de Langenstein
msItem.title: De reductione effectuum spiritualium in virtutes communes
msItem.incipit: Propter Ammirari inceperunt antiquitus homines prophetari
msItem.explicit: nos custodiat Marie filius Ihesus Cristus amen
msItem.finalRubric: Hec ille ⸻ Explicit edificium magistri Heinrici de Hassia limpidissimi speculatoris deo laus
Explicit tractatus magistri H. de Hassia de reduccione effectuum in suas causas

msItem.author: Henricus de Langenstein
msItem.title: De habitudine causarum et influxu naturae communis
msItem.rubric: (fol. 152r) Incipit tractus magistri Heinrici de Hassia de concathenacione causarum
msItem.incipit: Quia libenter vellem scire modum amministracionis
msItem.explicit: de se videtur propositum patere. Et hec sufficiant de habitudine causarum nature communis respectu miseriorum
msItem.colophon: Edita a subtili speculatore magistro Heinrico de Hassia scripta per manus Johannis de Ackenden’
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus M. Heinrici de Hassia de concathenacione causarum

supportDesc.support: parchment, frequently with uneven edges and flaws within the text area
supportDesc.collation: Uncertain; too tightly bound. There are catchwords on fols. 20v, 28v, 38v, 49v (?), 109v, 121v, and 133v.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in plummet for 2 columns; ruled space 265 180 with 17 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Cursive, by four scribes: A fols. 1r-16r; B fols. 16v-51r; C fols. 51r-118v; D fols. 119r-163v. The last signs as Johannes de Attendern (fol. 163v) (i.e. Attendorn, Westphalia?; perhaps to be identified with ‘Johannes de Attendern clericus Coloniensis’ who signed and dated Munich, BSB, Clm 3821 in 1416 at Konstanz: see N. Palmer, Zistercienser und ihre Bücher (1998), p. 289; Colophons, no. 8592).

decoDesc.decoNote: One large puzzle initial in a white metal (now oxidised) edged with red, and blue, with penwork in red and a gray-green (fol. 1r); others smaller, and with less metal (fols. 16v, 25r), one without penwork (fol. 65v).
One initial in the form of a fish with its head nearly cut off, a spear in its mouth (fol. 119r).
One pen-drawn initial in the form of a biting dragon (fol. 140v).
Other initials in plain red, 2 to 4 lines high.
Some cadels with human heads e.g. fols. 15v.
One marginal diagram of an isosceles or equilateral triangle with sides of different length (fol. 105v).

binding.p: Laudian binding. Sewn on six bands laced into pasteboards covered with brown leather, each cover stamped in gilt with the arms of Archbishop Laud; traces of two ties; the spine renewed.

physDesc.accMat: The endleaves (fols. iii, 164) are formed of two parts of a large document in Latin of the first half of the 15th century, erased and largely illegible.

history.provenance: Eberbach, Cistercian Abbey of the Virgin Mary, with their 15th-century ownership inscription, ‘Liber Sancte Marie virginis in Eburbach’ (fol. iii verso); in their 1502 library catalogue as H 20 (‘Tractatus divinalis wilhelmi parisiensis … Initium Secunda tabula post naufragium etc.’) (Palmer, op. cit., p. 240).
Archbishop William Laud (1573–1645), with the usual inscription, here dated 1638 (fol. 1r) and binding; inscribed ‘8’ (fols. iiir, 1r).
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639. Former Bodleian shelfmarks: ‘F. 109.’ (inside front cover, fol. iii verso) and ‘Laud 146’ (inside front cover).

recordHist.source: Description (June 2021) by Peter Kidd, edited by Matthew Holford. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 140 Quarto Catalogue, col. 141 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 49

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

revisionDesc.change: Description fully revised for Polonsky German digitization project.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
